title: How to Print Pictures from an iPhone

steps.title: Connect your AirPrint printer to your wireless network.
steps.content: Connect your AirPrint printer to your wireless network. The process for this will vary depending on your printer. Generally, you'll use the printer's built-in menu to select your wireless network and enter the password. You can see if your printer is AirPrint-compatible by checking Apple's support page . If your printer does not support AirPrint, see the next section.

steps.title: Put photo paper in your printer.
steps.content: Put photo paper in your printer. Most modern desktop printers will have a special tray for photo paper. This tray may be adjustable, and the location will vary depending on the printer. Refer to your printer's documentation for instructions on putting photo paper in the tray. Your iPhone will automatically send photos you print to your printer's photo paper tray.

steps.title: Tap the Settings app on your iPhone.
steps.content: Tap the Settings app on your iPhone. This may be in a folder labeled "Utilities."

steps.title: Tap the "Wi-Fi" option.
steps.content: Tap the "Wi-Fi" option.

steps.title: Ensure you're connected to the same network as the printer.
steps.content: Ensure you're connected to the same network as the printer. You'll need to be on the same local wireless network as the AirPrint printer. You cannot print to your AirPrint printer over the internet. If you're connected to a different network, tap the correct network in the list and enter the password when prompted.

steps.title: Press the Home button.
steps.content: Press the Home button. This will return you to the Home screen.

steps.title: Tap the Photos app.
steps.content: Tap the Photos app.

steps.title: Tap the Share button.
steps.content: Tap the Share button. You'll find this in the lower-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the photos you want to print.
steps.content: Tap the photos you want to print. You can select as many photos as you'd like. Make sure you don't select any videos, or you won't be able to access the Print option.

steps.title: Tap the "Next" button.
steps.content: Tap the "Next" button. This will open the list of sharing options.

steps.title: Tap "Print."
steps.content: Tap "Print." You'll find this in the second row of sharing options. You may have to swipe the row from right to left to see it.

steps.title: Tap "Select Printer."
steps.content: Tap "Select Printer." A list of available printers will appear.

steps.title: Tap your printer.
steps.content: Tap your printer. If your printer is not on the list, verify that it is connected to the same network as you and that it is AirPrint compatible. Restarting the printer and your router will usually fix connection errors.

steps.title: Toggle "Black & White" on (optional).
steps.content: Toggle "Black & White" on (optional). You can set your photos to print in black and white by toggling it on after selecting your printer. If you need more printing options, you may want to try the printing app from your printer's manufacturer. See the next section for details.

steps.title: Tap "Print" to print the selected photos.
steps.content: Tap "Print" to print the selected photos. Your printer will automatically attempt to print from the photo paper tray on your printer. Check out tips about printing from an iPhone on wikiHow’s “How do you print easily from an iPhone?" forum page .

steps.title: Connect your non-AirPrint printer to your wireless network.
steps.content: Connect your non-AirPrint printer to your wireless network. Your printer will need to be connected to your network in order to send photos to print. The process for this varies depending on the printer you're using. See Install a Network Printer for detailed instructions.

steps.title: Tap the App Store on your iPhone.
steps.content: Tap the App Store on your iPhone.

steps.title: Search for your printer manufacturer.
steps.content: Search for your printer manufacturer. For example, if you have a Canon printer, search for "canon."

steps.title: Download the printer app for your printer.
steps.content: Download the printer app for your printer. Most printer manufacturers have an app available that will allow you to connect to your printer. Find the app from your printer manufacturer and tap the "Get" button to download and install it.

steps.title: Tap your newly-installed printer app.
steps.content: Tap your newly-installed printer app.

steps.title: Tap the "Add Printer" button.
steps.content: Tap the "Add Printer" button. The printer registration process will vary depending on the app you're using, but generally you'll need to tap an "Add Printer" button and then search your network for available printers.

steps.title: Tap your printer.
steps.content: Tap your printer. If you're using the app from your printer's manufacturer, and the printer is connected to the same wireless network as your iPhone, you should see it in the list of available printers. If you don't see your printer, make sure that it is connected to the same network. Restarting the printer and the router may help.

steps.title: Tap the Photo Print option.
steps.content: Tap the Photo Print option. This will vary depending on the app, but you can typically browse the photos on your iPhone and iCloud and choose which you want to print.

steps.title: Tap the photos you want to print.
steps.content: Tap the photos you want to print. Navigate through your camera roll and select the photos that you want to send to your printer.

steps.title: Change your print settings.
steps.content: Change your print settings. Most printer apps give you more print settings options than AirPrint. You can usually choose the paper size and type, and other options may be available depending on the app.

steps.title: Tap "Print."
steps.content: Tap "Print." The selected photos will be sent to your printer and will print from the photo tray if photo paper is inserted.

steps.title: Tap the App Store.
steps.content: Tap the App Store. There are a variety of printing services available that will allow you to order prints to either be delivered to your house or picked up from popular retail outlets like CVS or Walgreens.

steps.title: Tap the Search tab.
steps.content: Tap the Search tab. You'll find this at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Search for "order photos."
steps.content: Search for "order photos." This will return a bunch of apps that will allow you to order prints for delivery or pickup.

steps.title: Tap "Get" for the app you want.
steps.content: Tap "Get" for the app you want. Some of the more popular print ordering apps include: Walgreens Snapfish PostalPix Shutterfly

steps.title: Tap your newly-installed photo app.
steps.content: Tap your newly-installed photo app. The interface will vary a lot depending on the app you're using.

steps.title: Choose the photos you want to order.
steps.content: Choose the photos you want to order. You'll be able to browse the photos on your device's camera roll, and in some apps you can browse your iCloud Photo Library as well.

steps.title: Tap the size and paper options you want.
steps.content: Tap the size and paper options you want. After selecting your images, you'll be able to choose the print size and paper type you want. Different options will have different costs.

steps.title: Select your delivery or pickup options.
steps.content: Select your delivery or pickup options. Depending on the service, you may be able to select your shipping speed, or when you want to pickup the pictures. These options will vary.

steps.title: Enter your payment information.
steps.content: Enter your payment information. After choosing all of your options, you'll be prompted to pay for your order. Some apps may include support for Apple Pay if you have that set up on your device. [1] X Research source
